intro: Symplocos quitensis subsp. quitensis, commonly known as the Andean beautyberry, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters.
